text: John Colum Crichton-Stuart, 7th Marquess of Bute (26 April 1958 - 22 March 2021),Ex-Formula 1 driver Marquess of Bute dies aged 62 styled Earl of Dumfries before 1993, was a Scottish peer and a racing driver. He won the 1988 24 Hours of Le Mans. He did not use his title and wanted to be known as John Bute. He died of cancer on 22 March 2021, aged 62. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:2021 deaths Category:People from Argyll and Bute Category:Scottish racecar drivers
title: John Crichton-Stuart, 7th Marquess of Bute
